name: Things-i-learned
body:
### Things that I've learned
This is a collection of things I've learned. I will make this a blog when there is enough content (~10K word count) here.
This repository is built to use Jekyll.

### Python
## An issue with pip
```bash
$ pip
Failed to execute process '/usr/local/bin/pip'. Reason:
The file '/usr/local/bin/pip' specified the interpreter '/usr/local/opt/python/bin/python3.7', which is not an executable command.
```
This happened after brew upgraded python3.7 to python3.8

Going to try installing pip again using the `--ignore-installed` switch
i.e.
`
curl https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py -o get-pip.py
python3 get-pip.py --ignore-installed
`

### Vim
## Spell Check
`]s` - Move to next misspelled word.
`[s` - search backwards.
`zg` - marks a word as good.
`z=` - suggest spelling.

### Author
Me (@ykrish)

note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
